column5: I might be getting a chance to go fishing at Little Esson Lake also known as Cedar Lake.  Has anybody fishing there and know what species are in this lake and any tips.  I can't really find any information on it.  Thanks.

Its stocked with rainbows, and also has bass.   The rainbow fishing is hit and miss, but when you get one, its usually a nice one. Troll the top 6ft of water, over deep water, and you might get lucky.  S.

My parents had a place very near there and one of my supervisors at work had a place on there, if I remember correctly there was Rainbows in there and probably smallmouth bass that are usually present in most Haliburton Lakes.  edit: might want to watch the closing date for bows , could be close.
I think rainbows are open all year up there, but check and make sure on that lake. I can't remember off the top of my head.  S.
